thread.title: Maaliyah Papillion crowned Miss Louisiana USA 2016
thread.title_full: Maaliyah Papillion crowned Miss Louisiana USA 2016 | Examiner.com

author: Michael McGuire
title: Maaliyah Papillion crowned Miss Louisiana USA 2016
text:
Miss Louisiana USA 2016 Maaliyah Papillion Maaliyah Papillion/Twitter.com Pageant judges crowned a new Miss Louisiana USA on Saturday night. Maaliyah Papillion holds the title of Miss Louisiana USA 2016. The victory qualifies her for next year's Miss USA Pageant . If she wins the national pageant, she will represent the United States in the Miss Universe Pageant. She entered the state pageant as Miss as Miss Lake Charles USA. In recent years, the Miss USA Pageant has been broadcast live on NBC. The pageant is under new ownership, and details for next year are not available.
The pageant was held at Heymann Performing Arts Center in Lafayette. Also crowned on its stage Saturday was Miss Louisiana Teen USA 2016 Ellie Picone. She entered the pageant as Miss Mandeville Teen USA. Picone will represent Louisiana at next year's Miss Teen USA Pageant. In recent years, the teen pageant has been held during the summer in The Bahamas, and webcast live on the Miss Teen USA website. The pageant is under new ownership, however, and the details of next year's pageant have not been released.
Both pageants are judged on the basis of contestants' performance in interview sessions, a swimsuit competition, and an evening gown competition. Contestants are not required to perform a talent. Miss USA contestants must be at least 18 and under 27 by Dec. 31. Miss Teen USA contestants must be at least 14 and under 19 by Dec. 31. Winning contestants participate in a variety of personal appearances, celebrity events , and charity work. To avoid conflicting with school studies, the events are scheduled for weekends, and far enough in advance to make plans.
